title: Benedict of Nursia
summary: Benedict of Nursia OSB (Latin: Benedictus Nursiae; Italian: Benedetto da Norcia; c. 2 March 480 – c. 21 March 548 AD) is a Christian saint venerated in the Catholic Church, the Eastern Orthodox Church, the Oriental Orthodox Churches, the Anglican Communion and Old Catholic Churches.[3] He is a patron saint of Europe.[4]
